chore\(v7.9.2\): eject Loa framework â€” protocol hygiene

Remove development framework for clean protocol distribution:

- Remove .loa/ git submodule and .gitmodules
- Remove evals/ framework test suite \(110 files\)
- Remove 86 .bats framework shell tests
- Remove Loa-specific docs \(process, visions, context, ledger\)
- Strip <!-- docs-version --> markers from protocol docs
- Clean CLAUDE.md, BUTTERFREEZONE.md, .gitignore, CONTRIBUTING.md
- Add CHANGELOG entries for v7.9.0, v7.9.1, v7.9.2
- Bump version 7.9.1 â†’ 7.9.2

Protocol source, schemas, constraints, vectors, and 5,390 tests unchanged.
BUTTERFREEZONE.md preserved and rewritten for protocol context.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(gh pr create --title "chore\(v7.9.2\): eject Loa framework â€” protocol hygiene" --body "$\(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- **Eject Loa framework** â€” Removed development framework for protocol distribution hygiene. No protocol schema, constraint, or API changes.

### Removed

- `.loa/` git submodule and `.gitmodules`
- `.claude` symlink \(framework-managed\)
- `evals/` framework test suite \(110 files\)
- 86 `.bats` framework shell tests \(bridge, butterfreezone, golden-path, constructs, etc.\)
- Loa-specific docs: `process.md`, `visions/`, `context/`, `ledger.json`
- All `<!-- docs-version -->` markers from docs

### Changed

- **BUTTERFREEZONE.md** â€” Rewritten to reflect protocol library \(removed Loa skill commands, three-zone model, adapter references\)
- **CLAUDE.md** â€” Stripped Loa framework import and submodule instructions
- **`.gitignore`** â€” Removed Loa-specific entries, added `.claude/` for Claude Code session state

### Unchanged

- All protocol source \(`src/`\)
- All schemas \(`schemas/`\)
- All constraints \(`constraints/`\)
- All conformance vectors \(`vectors/`\)
- All protocol tests \(`tests/**/*.test.ts`\)

### Verification

- `npm run build` â€” passes
- `npm run test` â€” 5,389 tests pass \(1 pre-existing flaky property fuzz test\)
- Version bump: 7.9.1 â†’ 7.9.2

## Test plan

- [x] TypeScript compilation passes
- [x] All 5,389+ protocol tests pass
- [x] No Loa framework artifacts remain in tracked files
- [x] BUTTERFREEZONE.md accurately reflects protocol library
- [x] CHANGELOG.md updated with v7.9.0, v7.9.1, v7.9.2 entries

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)
EOF
\)" --head feature/v5.0.0-multi-model --base main)

Bash(cat > /tmp/bridge-review-iter3.md << 'REVIEW_EOF'
## Bridgebuilder Third Reading â€” Iteration 3

**Bridge ID**: `bridge-20260225-c037bb`
**Iteration**: 3
**Scope**: v8.1.0 LOW finding refinements \(`90412cb`\)
**Prior findings addressed**: F11 \(LOW\), F12 \(LOW\), F13 \(LOW\), F14 \(LOW\)

---

### Executive Summary

Iteration 2 addressed all 4 LOW findings from the second reading. The changes are surgical and well-tested:

- **F11**: Factory invariant IDs now auto-increment via a module-scoped counter, preventing ID collisions when multiple factories serve the same resource. The `resetFactoryCounter\(\)` test utility ensures deterministic test execution.
- **F12**: `computeNegotiationExpiry\(\)` now returns `NaN` for invalid dates, matching the error handling posture of `isNegotiationValid\(\)`.
- **F13**: `GovernanceMutationEvalResult` gains `policy_evaluated: boolean` â€” callers can now programmatically distinguish "authorized by default" from "authorized after evaluation".
- **F14**: Three property tests for monotonic expansion verification â€” progressive accumulation, capability removal detection, and equal surface non-strict monotonicity.

**Verdict**: Flatline. No new findings of any severity. The protocol has reached convergence.

---

### Findings

<!-- bridge-findings-start -->
```json
[]
```
<!-- bridge-findings-end -->

---

### Findings Summary

| ID | Severity | Title |
|----|----------|-------|
| â€” | â€” | No findings |

### Metrics

- **Findings**: 0
- **HIGH findings**: 0
- **Tests added**: 5 \(2 NaN guards, 3 property tests\)
- **Score**: 0.000 \(flatline\)

### Previous Findings Status

| Original | Severity | Status |
|----------|----------|--------|
| F11 | LOW | **RESOLVED** â€” auto-incrementing invariant IDs |
| F12 | LOW | **RESOLVED** â€” NaN guard added |
| F13 | LOW | **RESOLVED** â€” policy_evaluated boolean |
| F14 | LOW | **RESOLVED** â€” 3 property tests added |
| F15 | INFO | **ACKNOWLEDGED** â€” consumer migration guide deferred |
| F16 | INFO | **ACKNOWLEDGED** â€” semver note documented |

### Cumulative Bridge Metrics

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Total iterations | 3 |
| Total sprints executed | 5 |
| Total findings addressed | 15 \(5 original + 10 bridge\) |
| Total files changed | 223 |
| Total tests | 6,269 \(222 files\) |
| Flatline score | 0.000 |
| Consecutive flatline | 2 |

**FLATLINE DETECTED** â€” Bridge loop terminates.
REVIEW_EOF
gh pr comment 37 --body-file /tmp/bridge-review-iter3.md)

Bash(cat > /tmp/pr-body-update.md << 'PREOF'
## feat\(v8.0.0 + v8.1.0\): Commons Protocol â€” GovernedResource substrate

### Summary

Introduces the **Commons Protocol** â€” a governance substrate for managing shared resources across the loa ecosystem. `GovernedResource<T>` wraps any domain type `T` with conservation laws, audit trails, state machines, and dynamic contracts.

### v8.0.0 â€” Foundation \(Sprints 1-8\)

| Sprint | Scope | Tests |
|--------|-------|-------|
| 1 | Invariant + ConservationLaw schemas | 35 |
| 2 | GovernanceMutation, AuditTrail, StateMachine | 55 |
| 3 | GovernedResource<T> instantiation \(Credits, Freshness, Reputation\) | 40 |
| 4 | Hash chain integrity \(SHA-256, domain tags, quarantine\) | 45 |
| 5 | Conformance vector distribution \(manifest, loader, packaging\) | 30 |
| 6 | DynamicContract, ProtocolSurface, ContractNegotiation | 35 |
| 7 | Integration tests + property-based tests | 35 |
| 8 | Version bump, schema generation, barrel export | 20 |

### v8.1.0 â€” Bridgebuilder Hardening \(5 sprints, 2 iterations\)

| Finding | Severity | Resolution |
|---------|----------|------------|
| F6 | HIGH | `actor_id` required on GovernanceMutation, `access_policy_ref`, `evaluateGovernanceMutation\(\)` |
| F7 | MEDIUM | Conservation law factories \(4 factories + 3 builders\) |
| F8 | MEDIUM | Checkpoint utilities \(create, verify, prune\) |
| F9 | MEDIUM | TTL validation with explicit clock parameter |
| F10 | MEDIUM | Monotonic expansion verification |
| F11-F14 | LOW | Auto-incrementing IDs, NaN guards, policy_evaluated flag, property tests |
| Q1-Q6 | STRATEGIC | ADR-008 \(Path B\), ADR-009 \(routing integration\), 12 property tests |

### Bridge Metrics

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Bridge iterations | 3 \(2 active + 1 flatline\) |
| Total sprints executed | 13 \(8 foundation + 5 hardening\) |
| Total findings addressed | 15 |
| Flatline score | 0.000 |

### Test Results

- **222 test files**, **6,269 tests** â€” ALL PASSING
- **189 JSON schemas** generated
- **14 property test files** with fast-check

### Key Files

- `src/commons/` â€” 15 source files \(schemas + utilities\)
- `tests/commons/` â€” 12 test files
- `tests/properties/` â€” 4 new property test files
- `docs/adr/ADR-008-governance-enforcement-sdk.md`
- `docs/adr/ADR-009-dynamic-contract-routing-integration.md`

### Commits

- `166ba78` feat\(sprint-8\): release v8.0.0
- `fec0fe1` fix\(bridge-1\): Bridgebuilder iteration 1 â€” 5 findings addressed
- `90412cb` fix\(bridge-2\): Bridgebuilder iteration 2 â€” 4 LOW findings addressed
PREOF

Bash(gh release create v8.2.0 --title "v8.2.0 â€” Commons Protocol + ModelPerformance" --body "$\(cat <<'EOF'
## Breaking Changes

- **v8.0.0** â€” New `commons` module with 21 governance substrate schemas \(`GovernedResource<T>`, `ConservationLaw`, `AuditTrail`, `StateMachine`, `DynamicContract`, `GovernanceError`, etc.\)
- **v8.1.0** â€” `GovernanceMutation.actor_id` now **required** \(was optional\). Add `actor_id: string` to all mutation payloads.

## Additions \(v8.2.0\)

- `ModelPerformanceEvent` â€” 4th `ReputationEvent` discriminated union variant. Closes the autopoietic feedback loop \(Dixie â†’ scoring â†’ routing â†’ Finn\).
- `QualityObservation` â€” Standalone quality evaluation schema: score [0,1], optional dimensions, latency, evaluator.
- `'unspecified'` TaskType literal â€” Reserved fallback when task metadata is unavailable.
- 23 new conformance vectors \(217 total\), property-based discrimination tests, integration tests.
- Governance Enforcement SDK: `evaluateGovernanceMutation\(\)`, conservation law factories, checkpoint utilities, contract TTL validation, monotonic expansion verification.
- ADR-006 through ADR-009 documenting hash chain, commons pattern, enforcement SDK, and dynamic contract integration decisions.

## Stats

- **6,393 tests** passing
- **193 schemas**, **219 vectors**, **87 constraints**
- **499 SHA-256 checksums** in `RELEASE-INTEGRITY.json`

## Migration

See [MIGRATION.md]\(./MIGRATION.md#v7110--v820-breaking\) for the full v7.11.0 â†’ v8.2.0 upgrade guide with per-consumer paths \(loa-finn, loa-dixie, arrakis/freeside\).

---

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)
EOF
\)")

Bash(gh release create v8.2.0 --title "v8.2.0 â€” Commons Protocol + ModelPerformance" --notes "$\(cat <<'EOF'
## Breaking Changes

- **v8.0.0** â€” New `commons` module with 21 governance substrate schemas \(`GovernedResource<T>`, `ConservationLaw`, `AuditTrail`, `StateMachine`, `DynamicContract`, `GovernanceError`, etc.\)
- **v8.1.0** â€” `GovernanceMutation.actor_id` now **required** \(was optional\). Add `actor_id: string` to all mutation payloads.

## Additions \(v8.2.0\)

- `ModelPerformanceEvent` â€” 4th `ReputationEvent` discriminated union variant. Closes the autopoietic feedback loop \(Dixie â†’ scoring â†’ routing â†’ Finn\).
- `QualityObservation` â€” Standalone quality evaluation schema: score [0,1], optional dimensions, latency, evaluator.
- `'unspecified'` TaskType literal â€” Reserved fallback when task metadata is unavailable.
- 23 new conformance vectors \(217 total\), property-based discrimination tests, integration tests.
- Governance Enforcement SDK: `evaluateGovernanceMutation\(\)`, conservation law factories, checkpoint utilities, contract TTL validation, monotonic expansion verification.
- ADR-006 through ADR-009 documenting hash chain, commons pattern, enforcement SDK, and dynamic contract integration decisions.

## Stats

- **6,393 tests** passing
- **193 schemas**, **219 vectors**, **87 constraints**
- **499 SHA-256 checksums** in `RELEASE-INTEGRITY.json`

## Migration

See [MIGRATION.md]\(./MIGRATION.md#v7110--v820-breaking\) for the full v7.11.0 â†’ v8.2.0 upgrade guide with per-consumer paths \(loa-finn, loa-dixie, arrakis/freeside\).
EOF
\)")
